page.title: 10HOUSING IN SADDLEWORTH
page.content: Most of the housing in the area today is owner-occupied. Many of the older properties have been extensively modernised. There are council houses dating from before the 1st World War in Diggle, & early photographs of the area show how the valley has become progressively populated since that time. There were large tips then, of spoil from the railway tunnels constructed at Standedge, but this was later landscaped to allow for more buildings. There are modern detached and semi- detached properties at Diggle and Uppermill, and on steeply- sloping sites they are usually split- level. Modern properties are usually made of brick or reconstituted stone, & the local quarries are now closed as there is little demand for stone now. The area is zoned for housing, primary employment & green belt/recreational.
